subject: mathematics
source: Uganda National Curriculum Development Centre (NCDC) - P3 Thematic Curriculum

themes.name: Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Compare and order numbers using symbols (>, <, =)
Add numbers within 50 using various strategies
Subtract numbers within 50 using various strategies
Recognize 2D and 3D shapes in the environment
Measure distances in the community using standard units
Collect and organize data about the community

themes.name: Livelihood in Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Count and group objects into tens
Understand basic multiplication as repeated addition
Introduce division as sharing and grouping
Solve word problems involving money and business
Calculate profits and losses in simple terms
Measure weights and capacity of goods
Understand cost, price and income concepts
Create simple graphs showing business data

themes.name: Our Environment in Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Measure area and perimeter of land
Use standard units for length, mass and capacity
Collect environmental data and represent in graphs

themes.name: Environment and Weather
competences: Use data to make predictions about weather
Understand time duration in weather observations
Calculate energy usage in relation to weather

themes.name: Living Things: Animals
competences: Count and classify animals by characteristics
Understand grouping and sets with animals
Create Venn diagrams showing animal classification
Understand basic multiplication through animal groups
Use data to understand animal habitats

themes.name: Living Things: Plants
competences: Create graphs showing plant growth data
Count and classify plants by characteristics
Understand basic division with plant seeds
Measure area for gardens and farms
Use multiplication for large seed quantities

themes.name: Water and Natural Resources
competences: Measure water volume using standard units
Understand fractions related to water sharing
Estimate water needs for different purposes

themes.name: Cultural Heritage
competences: Understand counting systems in different cultures
Estimate resource needs for cultural events

themes.name: Peace, Rights and Responsibilities
competences: Collect and interpret data on peace issues
Use data to understand community needs
Create pie charts showing community concerns

themes.name: Energy and Movement
competences: Measure distance and speed of movement
Solve problems involving movement and distance
Understand simple machines and mechanical advantage

themes.name: Communication and Technology
competences: Calculate time zones and time differences

themes.name: Trade and Commerce
competences: Use multiplication and division in trading
Solve problems involving buying and selling

learning_outcomes: Develop deeper understanding of numbers and place value
Understand basic multiplication and division concepts
Work with fractions in practical contexts
Measure and compare using standard units
Collect, organize, analyze and interpret data
Solve multi-step problems using mathematical reasoning
Apply mathematics to real-world situations in the community
